com.tiberiuslabs.BattleChess.GameState

Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiberiuslabs.BattleChess.GameState.GameBoard

  • public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds the current state of the game
    • which units are where on the board
    • which units are in the graveyard
    • which player's turn it is currently
    Author:
    Amandeep Gill

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameBoard()
      Default constructor
      GameBoard(GameBoard other)
      Copies the contents of the other GameBoard into this GameBoard

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard()
        Default constructor

      • GameBoard

        public GameBoard(GameBoard other)
        Copies the contents of the other GameBoard into this GameBoard
        Parameters:
        other - the GameBoard to get the game state information from, must not be null

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public Unit get(Position pos)
        Gets the Unit at the given position
        Parameters:
        pos - the board position to get the Unit from
        Returns:
        the Unit at the given position if one exists, return null if there is no Unit at the position or the position is not inBounds

      • set

        public boolean set(Unit unit,
          Position position)
        Sets the new recruit to the position given if the position is available and the recruit has come from the graveyard
        Parameters:
        unit - the unit to recruit
        position - the position to put the recruit at
        Returns:
        true if the unit was successfully recruited, false otherwise

      • move

        public Unit move(Position startPos,
        Position finalPos)
        Moves the Unit at startPos to finalPos, if a unit is already at finalPos it gets removed from the board and added to the graveyard. Performs no validity or sanity checks.
        Parameters:
        startPos - the starting position of the unit that is moving
        finalPos - the final position to move the unit to
        Returns:
        the unit that was removed from play, null otherwise

      • numActiveUnits

        public int numActiveUnits(Color player)
        Gets the number of units that the player has on the board
        Parameters:
        player - the player's color
        Returns:
        a head count of all the player's units still alive

      • getActiveUnits

        public java.util.Set<Unit> getActiveUnits(Color player)
        Gets the set of the players active units
        Parameters:
        player - the player's color
        Returns:
        the set of all the units that the player has on the board

      • hasMonarch

        public boolean hasMonarch(Color player)
        Checks whether the player has an active monarch
        Parameters:
        player - the player's color
        Returns:
        returns true if the player has an active monarch, false otherwise

      • getGraveyard

        public java.util.Set<Unit> getGraveyard(Color player)
        Gets a copy of the player's current graveyard
        Parameters:
        player - the player's color
        Returns:
        the copy of the player's graveyard, returns the white player's graveyard if the player color is not black
